alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 2:18PM MST until June 26 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 515 PM MST. * At 217 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Show Low, Taylor, Shumway, Linden, Pinedale, Clay Springs, Fort Apache Reservation, Fool Hollow Lake Campground, White Mountain Lake and Lewis Canyon Group Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 77 between mile markers 343 and 357. State Route 260 between mile markers 324 and 345. Highway 60 between mile markers 337 and 351. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cottonwood Wash, Linden Draw, Porter Creek, Silver Creek, Hog Wash, Billy Creek, Show Low Creek, Forestdale Creek, Rocky Arroyo, Pinedale Wash, Dodson Wash and Brown Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
